headline: Three Egg Omelet
description: Ham, turkey, Cheddar cheese and vegetables are the filling for these big stuffed omelets that will satisfy appetites of all sizes!
name: Three Egg Omelet

recipeInstructions.text: Spray or lightly grease a large skillet and heat over medium heat.

Crack 3 eggs into a glass measuring cup and beat with a fork or whisk until scrambled. Pour eggs into heated skillet, swirling the pan to coat the bottom. Cover and let cook until eggs are firm, about 2 minutes.

Top with 1/4 each of the chopped ham, turkey, green onions, tomato, parsley, green bell pepper, and Cheddar cheese. Fold egg in half over fillings, and serve warm. Repeat with remaining ingredients for 4 omelets.

review.reviewBody:
This was my first time making an omelette. I used cut up deli shaved ham and two kinds of grated cheese.
It was delicious but huge. Next time I will use just two eggs.

Simple and delicious! I just used ham, cheddar and pepper jack cheese, b/c that's how hubby likes it. I topped it with cheese hearts, which turned out really cute. Served with hash browns~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
I enjoyed this three egg omelet. The vegetables suggested were just right for me.

My husband said I really raised the bar with this recipe. I didn't have any ham or turkey, so with just cheese, tomato, bell peppers and green onions, I still found this recipe easy-to-use and had excellent results!
I left out the sliced turkey because I did not have any. I also used red pepper instead of green. Very filling.

Very good and easy to make! I cut this down to one serving for a three egg omelet. I didn't use turkey meat and just eyeballed the ingredients. I added a little salt and pepper. Perfect with a side of multi-grain toast and orange juice.

This was super yummy! I cooked the onion and meat in a bit of butter, also adding diced turkey sausage patties, for about 5 minutes, then added the bell pepper and two shakes of dried parsley since I didn't have fresh, and cooked for another 7-8 minutes. I also added the tomato, salt and pepper in the last 2 minutes. Once done, I placed a small layer of finely shredded fiesta blend cheese on one half of the cooked egg (sprayed pan I used for egg with an olive oil spray and beat egg with salt and pepper added), then placed the mixture on top and folded the egg over that. Served some with sour cream and salsa. GREAT breakfast, thanks!!

I had never made an Omelet before and this recipe was helpful! I followed another review and cooked over med lo heat. I should have let it cook a tad longer though. The only thing I didn't have on hand was tomato but it was still tasty!!
Used this recipe to teach myself how to make an omelet. Turned out great, used left over ham and cheese.
This is similar to what I did but I won't eat hard types of cheese in omelets. I use nacho cheese sauce.
Easy to make. I sauted the pepper, added sweet onion and 1/4 c of chopped pineapple. Also used only ham. I also added blue cheese. It will be a Sunday morning staple.
I didn't have the turkey or the tomatoe, so I just left that part out. Still, very good though!
VERY GOOD...I OMITTED THE PEPPERS AND TOMATOES BECAUSE MY HUSBAND DOESNT LIKE THEM...STILL GOOD WITH JUST THE MEAT AND CHEESE.
Very good! Even my picky son liked this omelet. He ate two and he never does that! This goes in the recipe box.
This recipe was good but medium is too high to cook the eggs thoroughly on the inside. I had to turn the heat down to medium low so that all the egg was cooked properly.
